intro: Cuphonotus andraeanus, commonly known as the Andraeanus cuphonotus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
